text:
thought it'd belong here
a (fairly mediocre) attempt at trying to create a believable conlang family for an art project
frozen as of now
docs in Russian
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1nu3Z5CYyaPkbfIZVIvrp2rxvjCkEbS5vJ_VCLja25Ko/edit?usp=sharing
That's a pity the notation isn't in the IPA; difficult to read unfortunately

there's a dedicated page for IPA / Iskandari-Latin script
I didn't have an all-time access to IPA chart at the time of making it
"–ø–∏—Å—å–º–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å" (script) intended originally for in-universe script development but turned out to be a plain abecedary

> new IAL
> looks inside
> simplified Latin with a buncha Germanic roots
But I don't get the [v…°] => [√∞] change

I also did a "half-conlang" trying to predict a spontaneous IAL that emerges as a creole during excessive globalisation
It's also for an art project (a sci-fi book set in 2300s with humankind unifying in the background circa 2100s) and NEVER intended as a true real-world IAL
basically simplified English grammar with phonetic Latin script and an unholy mix of roots from all the major (>200M speakers) languages

likely arbitrary and totally baseless, been making consonant clusters a while ago
retrospectively the South > Insular isolate has a buncha more stages involving bilabial > linguolabial > alveolar sibilants, but that's a stretch

Well, that's not gonna happen
But I'm also fascinated by the idea that the modern languages we speak today will once be considered ancient, and no alive person would be able to speak them as a native, even though they'll have all the audiorecording we're missing today
I said "fairly mediocre", blunders can and will occur and I am open to criticism

it also fascinates me that OES was considered a vulgar speech language
like, people really spoke that a thousand years ago
I'm gradually (and not really successfully) making a world with the extensive space colonisation and language families derived from the most popular modern languages

I don't think it will either
but I had to make a "unified language" for a society that unified under "aggressive inclusivity" (basically fascism based around Euramerican liberal left values)
and I also wanted it exotic
again, it's not even a full-blown conlang, just mixed a buncha roots in a simple grammatic framework and done
kinda like newspeak, sans the meaning changes and doublethink
I've been trying to do it with English first, but then I dropped it for a bit and went for future Polish and Russian, and the result is kinda shocking me as a native Slavic speaker ü§£
And the thing is, in my world there will definitely be a need for such a thing, but I'm thinking if Modern English as the equivalent of Latin in Medieval Europe

However, predicting the accent is really difficult
Will they read the confusing Modern English orthography consistently? So that enough rimes with through, for example

the famous Morshu monologue in Jener Lang (Human Koine):
Lehtes, kordes, bombes? Tu kuerir essem? Esses tuer, eger tomodac, venn tu imir geneg rupies.
Hoivai, Link, eg kredit donir mocir nai. Revenirene venn tu hoti binir, mmm, ricerka!
English original:
Lamp oil (in translation: lamps), rope, bombs? You want it? It's yours, my friend, as long as you have enough rupees.
Sorry, Link, I can't give credit. Come back when you're a little, mmm, richer!
again, this is NOT intended as an IAL and should be perceived as more of a parody on one in an oppressive society
Great and Bread rhyme with Dream?

also, despite the presence of Mandarin and Arabic words, they are few (because in that timeline the Evil Regime basically nuked the Middle East into glass for incompliance and there was a standoff with the mainland China
Mandarin words are actually used (like jen [from Mandarin ren] for human as a Homo sapiens, distinct from djiva [a sapient alien] and ningen [human in terms of being sapient overall, closer to "human spirit" in terms of humanism and ethics, adjacent to "citizen" in high register]), but Arabic ones aren't as frequent
no offence to real Chinese and Muslims, the Evil Regime is clearly shown as Evil
Wow, this is actually a perfect project for a same-themed film

actually, it was born from a misheard lyric from a Death Note 2nd OP "Wha' up, people?!"
the misheard lyric goes as:
Oy vey, ningen sucker, duh, ningen ningen fucker (totally not intended in the original Japanese lyrics)
the resulting phrase in Jener Lang:
Hoivai, ningen saker (bin), e ta ningen ningen faker (bin)
lit. "Alas, humans are evil, and the enemy of a human is a human themself"
saker iningen = "an evil person"
ningen saker (bin) = "humans are evil" (singular as plural, cf Russian "—á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ–∫ –∂–µ—Å—Ç–æ–∫")

english is a giant meme
japanese (which has a surprisingly similar history!) is a little more consistent

native peoples migrate from the continent to islands (Angles, Saxons / Yamato)
oppress locals (Celts / Emishi)
learn from other continental people (French, Normans / Chinese, Koreans) [yes, I know that England was *conquered* by Wilhelm and Japan wasn't conquered by the Chinese]
inherit a script/orthography and more than half of the vocabulary (60% of English vocab is Romance in origin + orthography is modeled after French for some time / Japanese use kanji with both native and Chinese readings, and kana is derived from kanji)
Do you know that Englishers can say 595 as "five ninety five"?
A little bit further and they'll pronounce it as "five nine five"
